channel.title: Comments on: Best Self Balancing Scooters & Hoverboards 2017 – Buyer’s Guide

item.title: By: Petr
item.dc:creator: Petr
item.description: Thats pretty cool that such a small hoverboard can reach a distance up to 14 miles, the batteries must be very powerfull.
item.content:encoded: Thats pretty cool that such a small hoverboard can reach a distance up to 14 miles, the batteries must be very powerfull.

item.title: By: Donald
item.dc:creator: Donald
item.description: The Swagtron T1 is my favorite too at the moment. I'm waiting for the Swagtron T6 though - I heard at CES 2017 that it's coming out sometime this year and I love off road hoverboards.
item.content:encoded: The Swagtron T1 is my favorite too at the moment. I’m waiting for the Swagtron T6 though – I heard at CES 2017 that it’s coming out sometime this year and I love off road hoverboards.

item.title: By: Raheel Ahmed
item.dc:creator: Raheel Ahmed
item.description:
Hi Daniel,
As per the requirement of the US government, and the safety standards most hoverboard come with a UL2722 certification, this means that there is the complete guarantee that hoverboard won’t overheat, will have the battery short circuit, or spontaneously catch fire. Most of the hoverboards listed in our guide are UL2722 certified. Keeping in view your requirements we can recommend a few of our choices i.e SwagTron T1, Street Saw and Jetson Rover V8 all of these are UL2722 certified.
Cheers!
item.content:encoded:
Hi Daniel,

As per the requirement of the US government, and the safety standards most hoverboard come with a UL2722 certification, this means that there is the complete guarantee that hoverboard won’t overheat, will have the battery short circuit, or spontaneously catch fire. Most of the hoverboards listed in our guide are UL2722 certified. Keeping in view your requirements we can recommend a few of our choices i.e SwagTron T1, Street Saw and Jetson Rover V8 all of these are UL2722 certified.

Cheers!

item.title: By: Adrian
item.dc:creator: Adrian
item.description: I agree, the swagtron T1 looks perfect for beginners but hoverzon's self balancing scooter has a motor that has it's sensitivity tuned down for new riders . The fast hover boards are definitely reserved for the intermediate and expert riders.
item.content:encoded: I agree, the swagtron T1 looks perfect for beginners but hoverzon’s self balancing scooter has a motor that has it’s sensitivity tuned down for new riders . The fast hover boards are definitely reserved for the intermediate and expert riders.

item.description: That StreetSaw looks badass. Also noticed they have some other cool models on their site that aren't listed here.
